DOC.brief_title: Perineural Versus Systemic Dexamethasone Prolong Regional Anesthesia Front Foot Surgery
DOC.detailed_description: This prospective , randomize , double-blind control trial . All Patients undergoing front foot surgery metacarpal osteotomy screen inclusion protocol . All patient without exclusion criterion include study . All patient receive 30cc mixure Ropivacaine 0,375 % perineural injection surgery perform regional anesthesia . If need , sedation midazolam ( 1mg ) perform . The patient randomize 2 group : - `` Perineural group '' : - 1cc ( 4mg ) dexamethasone administrate perineural injection - 2.5cc isotonic saline solution administrate systemic injection - `` Systemic group '' : - 1cc isotonic saline administrate perineural injection - 2.5cc ( 10mg ) dexamethasone administrate systemic injection For group perineural injection perform ankle follow nerve target : tibial nerve , saphenous nerve , deep fibular nerve , superficial fibular nerve sural nerve . Post-operative analgesia reach paracetamol ( 1gr 6 hour ) Ketoprofen ( 100mg 12 hour ) . After surgery , patient ask write time first opioids request first 48 hour , maximal pain first 48H use visual analog scale , occurrence nausea vomiting , overall satisfaction regard pain relief management significant side effect first 7 day . The primary objective study determine perineural dexamethasone associate longer analgesic duration systemic route combination regional anesthesia ( Ropivacaine 0.375 % ) front foot surgery . The primary end-point time first opioids request first 48 hour .
